snippet: In a case symbolic of clashes over copyright online, a federal court ruled that copyright holders must consider fair use before asking YouTube to remove content.
abstract: United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, in San Francisco, rules that copyright holders must consider fair use before asking YouTube to remove content; move clears way for copyright case involving YouTube video of baby dancing to Prince song Let's Go Crazy to go to trial.
lead_paragraph: In a case symbolic of clashes over copyright online, a federal court ruled that copyright holders must consider fair use before asking YouTube to remove content.

headline.main: YouTube ‘Dancing Baby’ Copyright Ruling Sets Fair Use Guideline
headline.print_headline: Copyright Ruling Aims at Fair Use on the Web
